So verse 12 says teach us to number our days that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom. I want you to notice the end of verse number 9 where the Bible says that we spend our years as a tale that is told. occurrences.text: that this, the dealing with the subject matter that is before us of this first attribute, the holiness of God, that our God is holy, it really is His most prominent attribute that we find in the Word of God, and we find that it means to be perfectly pure. We find that it means to be complete in moral character. You understand that our God is not becoming holy, He is holy, and He will ever be. We find that the psalmist declares in Psalm 99, in verse number 9, exalt the Lord our God and worship at His holy hill, for the Lord our God is holy. And this evening, we think about the holiness of God, and we begin to understand as we review the attributes of God, we begin to understand how He transcends us, and we begin to notice the way that He would interact with us. And this evening, we have to rejoice at the fact that we serve a God who is perfectly holy. In fact, the psalmist, on more than one occasion, gives this admonition to the reader that we are to give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness. When we're mindful that our God is holy, it ought to cause us to rejoice. We find that we sang, actually this past Sunday morning, we sang, Holy, Holy, Holy. And what a great song it is to just pause and just reflect in the holiness of our God.
